topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitor the Network Access (Ping)

body.p: Cloud admins can use the Icinga service running in the undercloud to monitor the network access of all the Swift nodes. The host that are part of ring can be determined using swift-ring-builder and only those nodes are verified for connectivity.

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud.

section.title: Monitoring the Network Access of the Host
section.p: Perform the following steps to monitor the network access of the host:

ol.li:
In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:
Username: icingaadmin
Password: icingaadmin

Click Status on the left panel and click Host Details.
The page navigates to the Host Status Details for all Hosts.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address > and displays the the status of host for network connectivity.

row.entry: All nodes are reachable. Tested OK.
